Grotworms are monsters found on the middle level of the Grotworm Lair, which is located northwest of the Port Sarim lodestone within the White Knight Camp. They attack with melee when within melee range and magic when out of melee range. They have an average attack speed, but they can hit fairly accurately for their level.

Rare drop table[edit | edit source]

This monster has access to the rare drop table.
Luck-enhancing items are not required to access the table, but they will increase the chance of accessing the rare drop table and may also improve the loot received from it.

Universal drops[edit | edit source]

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.
Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch
Key token1RareNot soldNot alchemisable
Mimic kill token (m)11/10,00095,216Not alchemisable

Achievement[edit | edit source]

  • Guardian of the Realm ( 0) – Obtained a collection of unique drops from Slayer monsters located within Asgarnia & Misthalin.
    • Royal cape drop

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 19 August 2019 (Update):
    • Grotworms are able to damage the player once again.
  • ninja 25 April 2016 (Update):
    • Improved respawn rates for Grotworms.
  • patch 18 March 2013 (Update):
    • Grotworms, moss giants, banshees, jungle spiders, shadow spiders, spiders, giant spiders, deadly red spiders, ice spiders, scorpions, poison scorpions and pit scorpion will no longer hit for 1 hit point worth of damage.
  • patch 22 November 2012 (Update):
    • Grotworms are now non-aggressive.
  • update 22 May 2012 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Grotworm is Dutch for Cave worm.
  • Before an update, Grotworms commonly dropped rune items, such as rune longswords, rune scimitars, and runite ore. But due to excessive botting, Jagex removed most of these items and lowered the possibility of receiving these items as a drop.
